conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics for a closed system: ΔU = Q - W.
For a cyclic process, ΔU over one complete cycle is zero.
Q = W for a cyclic process.
Net heat exchanged is equal to the net work done by the gas during the cycle.
Work done by the gas is the area under expansion processes (A to B and C to D), and work done on the gas is the area under compression processes (B to C and D to A).
Net work done by the gas is the difference between the areas of ABCD and ABDA.
Area of rectangle ABCD represents the work done by the gas.
Area of rectangle ABDA represents the work done on the gas.
W = Area of ABCD - Area of ABDA.
Given P1, P2, V1, and V2 are known quantities.
Substitute areas into net work expression: W = (V2 - V1)(P2 - P1) - (V2 - V1)P1.
Amount of heat exchanged Q = W = (V2 - V1)(P2 - 2P1).
